title: Research
text:
My research interests lie in the intersection of statistics and machine learning. I am particularly interested in using causality to enhance the robustness and generalizability of statistical models. I care about applications of statistical methodologies in applied science domains such as biology and medical sciences. I enjoy developing softwares in R and python.

List of publications and preprints

Huang S, Wolkowicz H (2018). “Low-rank matrix completion using nuclear norm minimization and facial reduction.” Journal of Global Optimization, 72(1), 5-26. doi.
El Khatib A, Huang S, Ghodsi A, Karray F (2018). “Nonnegative matrix factorization using autoencoders and exponentiated gradient descent.” In 2018 International Joint Conference on Neural Networks (IJCNN), 1-8. IEEE. doi.

title: Shimeng Huang
text:
Hi, my name is Shimeng Huang. I’m currently a PhD candidate in Statistics at the University of Copenhagen under the supervision of Niklas Pfister and Jonas Peters. I’m a member of the Copenhagen Causality Lab (CoCaLa).

title: Biography
text:
Personal background
I was born and raised in Tianjin, China, and my name in Chinese characters is 黄诗萌.
In July 2014, I continued my undergraduate study at the University of Waterloo, Canada. After spending some enjoyable years in the Greater Toronto Area (specifically Waterloo, Mississauga, Toronto), I decided to move to Denmark to pursue my PhD degree in September 2021.
